children.name: Academic Bio
text: I am a PhD student at the~Programming Methodology Group, ETH~Zurich, supervsed by Prof.~Peter~Müller. My current focus is on developing scalable and precise automated formal reasoning techniques for program verification.
Before joining ETH in~2015, I have been Research Scientist at Intel's Strategic~CAD~Labs, working on tools for automatically debugging power and performance bugs in Android.

Prior to that, I was a member of one of Intel's optimizing compiler R&D projects in which I applied machine learning for automatically tuning compiler optimizations as well as designing novel optimizations for an explicitly parallel host architecture.

children.name: Projects
text: I am a member of the Viper project, developing an intermediate language and the infrastructure for deductive formal verification. My main focus is on extending Viper's specification features, enabling modular verification of heap reachability, comprehensions, etc. I am currently the main developer of Viper~IDE.

children.name: Movies
text: I like to watch movies in my free time. My favorite filmmaker David~Lynch; he's wonderful.
